name: 楊元森
objective: This course introduces basic physical, chemical, and mechanical properties of materials commonly employed in civil engineering works, and the influence of these properties on the performance and use of materials.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to civil engineering materials: basic units
Week 2: Introduction to civil engineering materials: steel
Week 3: Introduction to civil engineering materials: concrete
Week 4: Homework / assignment check
Week 5: Engineering units and their conversions
Week 6: Force, deformation, strain, stress, and modulus of elasticity (uniaxial) 
Week 7: Steel: basic properties / grades
Week 8: Midterm Simulation
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: Steel: sections
Week 11: Steel: Heat treatment, fastening
Week 12: Steel: Reinforcing, connections, fabric 
Week 13: Concrete: types, basic properties
Week 14: Concrete: hydration, setting, hardening, workability
Week 15: Aggregates: basic properties (moisture contents, porosity, void contents, specific gravity)
Week 16: Aggregates: gradation
Week 17: Spreadsheet Skills for material data processing
Week 18: Final
materials: Michael S. Mamlouk & John P. Zaniewski (2010), Materials for Civil and Construction Engineers 3rd Ed, Pearson. ISBN: 978-0-13-800956-4
